text: The Yale Review of Law and Social Action was a student-edited quarterly that was published by Yale University from 1970 to 1973. Hillary Rodham served on its Board of Editors and was an associate editor while attending Yale Law School.http://www.encyclopediaofarkansas.net/encyclopedia/entry- detail.aspx?entryID=2744Google Books - A Woman in Charge: The Life of Hillary Rodham Clinton ==References== Category:American law journals Category:Quarterly magazines published in the United States Category:Student magazines published in the United States Category:Defunct magazines published in the United States Category:Magazines established in 1970 Category:Magazines disestablished in 1973 Category:Magazines published in Connecticut Category:Social law Category:Yale Law School Category:Mass media in New Haven, Connecticut
title: Yale Review of Law and Social Action
